archdesc.bioghist: In 1994 the University of Michigan's Learning in Retirement program, an affiliate of the Turner Geriatric Clinic, sponsored a series of lectures commemorating the 50th anniversary of D-Day. One of the sessions was devoted to personal narratives of World War II experiences, told by eighteen members of Learning in Retirement.
archdesc.scopecontent: The collection consists of two VHS videocassettes (one the raw footage of the program of personal narratives, the other an edited copy), along with a printed transcript of the presentations together with written reminiscences submitted by other Learning in Retirement members. The transcripts were edited by Catherine Thoburn and Janet Knapp. The videographer was Harry A. Grow.
